alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 9:22PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, central Bergen and eastern Passaic. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 922 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms capable of producing urban and small stream flooding. As of 920 PM, between 1/2 and 1 inch of rain had fallen in spots west of the Garden State Parkway. - Rainfall of 1/2 to 3/4 inch is expected over eastern portions of Bergen County where heavy rain was just moving in. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Paterson, Wayne, Bergenfield, Paramus, Ridgewood, Pompton Lakes, Englewood, Hawthorne, Oradell, Fair Lawn, Elmwood Park, Dumont, Wyckoff, New Milford, Tenafly, Saddle Brook, Glen Rock, River Edge, Totowa and Maywood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
